intro: Draba bajtenovii, commonly known as the Bajtenov's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small annual or biennial herb that typically grows in rocky or arid environments. The plant features basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape, and its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, arranged in a raceme. Draba bajtenovii is native to Central Asia and is adapted to harsh, dry conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for studying plant adaptations to extreme climates.
